Technical and Bibliographic Notes / Notes techniques et bibliographiques 



The Institute has attempted to obtain the best original 
copy available for filming. Features of this copy which 
may be bibliographically unique, which may alter any of 
the images in the reproduction, or which may 
significantly change the usual method of filming are 
checked below. 



Coloured covers / 
Couverture de couleur 



□ Covers damaged / 
Couverture endommag^e 

□ Covers restored and/or laminated / 
Couverture restaur^ et/ou pellicul^e 

I Cover title missing / Le titre de couverture manque 

I I Coloured maps / Cartes g6ographiques en couleur 

I 1 Coloured ink (i.e. other than blue or black) / 



Encre de couleur (i.e. autre que bieue ou noire) 

Coloured plate-, -nd/or illustrations / 
Planches et/ou liiustrations en couleur 



D 
D 
D 



D 



D 



Bound with other material / 
Rdli6 avec d'autres documents 

Only edition available / 
Seule Edition disponible 

Tight binding may cause shadows or distortion along 
interior margin / La reliure serr^e peut causer de 
I'ombre ou de la distorsion le long de la marge 
int^rieure. 

Blank leaves added during restorations may appear 
within the text. Whenever possible, these have been 
omitted from filming / II se peut que certaines pages 
blanches ajout6es lors d'une restauration 
apparaissent dans le texte, mais, lorsque cela 6tait 
possible, ces pages n'ont pas 6t6 film6es. 

Additional comments / 
Commentaires supplemental res: 



L'Institut a microfilm^ le meilleur exemplaire qu'il lui a 
6t6 possible de se procurer. Les details de cet exem- 
plaire qui sont peut-§tre uniques du point de vue bibli- 
ographique, qui peuvent modifier une image reproduite, 
ou qui peuvent exiger une modification dans la m6tho- 
de normale de filmage sont indiqu^s ci-dessous. 

I I Coloured pages / Pages de couleur 

I I Pages damaged / Pages endommag6es 



D 



Pages restored and/or laminated / 
Pages restaur^es et/ou pellicul^es 



A Pages discoloured, stained or foxed / 

iiJ Pages d6color6es, tachet6es ou piqu^es 

I I Pages detached / Pages d6tach6es 

I y\ Showthrough / Transparence 

~7] Quality of print varies / 

■^ ' Quality in6gale de I'impression 



n 



D 



Includes supplementary material / 
Comprend du materiel suppl6mentaire 

Pages wholly or partially obscured by errata slips, 
tissues, etc., have been refilmed to ensure the best 
possible image / Les pages totalement ou 
partiellement obscurcies par un feuillet d'errata, une 
pelure, etc., ont et6 film6es k nouveau de fagon k 
obtenir la meilleure image possible. 

Opposing pages with varying colouration or 
discolourations are filmed twice to ensure the best 
possible image / Les pages s'opposant ayant des 
colorations variables ou des decolorations sont 
film6es deux fois afin d'obtenir la meilleure image 
possible. 



Thia Kern it filmed at the reduction ratio checked below / 

Ce document est 1\imi au taux da reduction indique cl-dessoua.

Tha copy filmed h«r« has b««n rapreducad thanka 
to tha ganarosity of: 

National Library of Canada 



L'axamplaira filmi fut raproduit graca * la 
gintrosit* da: 

Bibliotheque nationale du Canada 



Ths imagaa appaaring hara ara tha bast quality 
possibia considaring tha condition and lagibility 
of tha original copy and in kaaping with tha 
filming contract spacifications. 



Las imagas suivantas ont AtA rsproduitas avac Is 
plus grand soin, compta tanu da la condition at 
da la nanat* da Taxamplaira filmi, at an 
conformity avac las conditions du contrat da 
fiimaga. 



Original copios in printed papar covars ara filmad 
beginning with tha front cover end ending on 
the last page with a printed or illusvreted impree- 
sion. or tha back cover when appropriate. All 
other original copies ara filmed beginning on tha 
first page with a printed or illustrated impres- 
sion, and ending on the last pege with e printed 
or illustrated impression. 



The last recorded frame on each microfiche 
shall contain tha symbol -♦• (meaning "CON- 
TINUED"), or tha symbol V (meaning "END"), 
whichever appliea. 

Mapa, plates, charts, etc.. may be filmed at 
different reduction ratios. Those too large to be 
entirely included in one exposure are filmed 
beginning in the upper left hend corner, left to 
right and top to bottom, as many frames as 
required. The following diagrams illustrate the 
method: 



Lea axemplaires origirtaux dont la couverture an 
pepier est imprimte sont fiim^s en commencant 
per le premier plat at en terminant soit par la 
darni^re page qui comporta una empreinte 
d'impression ou d'illustration, soit par la second 
plat, salon la cas. Tous lea autres axemplaires 
originaux sont filmAs en commencant par la 
premiere page qui compone une empreinte 
d'impression ou d'illustration at en torminant par 
la darni*ra page qui comporta una telle 
ampratnta. 

Un das symbolas suivants apparaitra sur la 
darni*re image da cheque microfiche, selon le 
cas: la symbola -» signifie "A SCIIVRE", le 
symboia V signifie "FIN". 

Les cartaa. planchea. tableaux, etc.. peuvent etra 
film*s * das taux da reduction diffArants. 
Lorsqua le document est trop grand pour Atra 
raproduit en un seul clich*. il est film* i pertir 
de Tangle supArieur gauche, de gauche A droits. 
et de haut an bas. an prenant la nombre 
d'imagea nAcassaira. Lea diagrammes suivants 
illustrant la mithoda.

March IH Wfathcr. a.- usual in Siberia. <leliy:htfully clear. .At Kl-.W, accom- 
panie.l l.y .Serut. I.ahatt. set out to see Irkutsk. We crossed to the city on the 
ue stoppiM- for a i.iinute to observe some women washin- clothes throuKh a hole 
m the ice. apparently quite hap|)y in spite of the bitter cold. On reachin"- the 
northern bank, the (irst lu.iMmy- on the rijrht was a larire white structure evidently 
u>r, fo! olicial purposes. I he white walls of this building were pitted like a 

■ockinarke,! face and. on enquirm-, we found that our surmise was correct and 
tla the marks were made by the bullets of the Czechs when driving' the Bol- 
e ' ' t'h, e'^f^rr^-y- ^T l:>\^^"''' ^■•■-'^ « ('"'''>^«nt HtHe park at the river's 

'or,; \ ev.',n, ^i m t'' ■'f/\^^'''h.,^^'''^ -' remarkably fine monument to the Em- 

P or Alexander HI Ire Holsheviks must have overlooked this, because it was 
not defaced or mutilated. One of their lirst actions when they win control of a 

ity IS to deface monuments, removinvr all crowns and Imperial insijjnia. We asked 

e'rv liUl, ..rrr, ''l''f''''"' '"^ '\" °"^.""'y ';"'""'»" ton^rue was Russian-and 
\tr> little of that- before we ciuite realized the situation, we were taken to the 

/echo-S ovak ( onsulate, led through an ante-room tilled with Czech officers who 
II' f ll'u ■ L- u"^ ^mention, and ushered into the presence of the Consul him- 

i til ee,, ./'*■"'■''• ^"''''' '"i' u-'^"'- -"^'y ^''''-'''^ '' '-^^y '"-^^^ "t the best and 
all seemed to es. ape me at this moment especially, but 1 managed to explain 
that we had not intended to bother him but that two of his soldiers had misumer 
stood our inqmnes for the British Consulate and that our only wish was ?o see 
Wnf, '"'.",""' i"t'''--^tL"'-: ''Uildinu^s in Irkutsk. The Consul (a major in the Czech 
4 ;v i;. I "u"";;''^'''" ^'"^•^'•fiVf Prague, Joseph Blahoz) was kin.l enough 
to sa\ that he wouM uive us a ( zech soldier to escort us through the city It 
turned out that our cicerone was Private Ernest Koubichka, a j^ra, ulte of the 
.Sorbonne ,n Paris and Irofessor of French in the University of Prague He 
slieaks Hench, (.erman Russian and Czech perfectly, but En-lish he tauirht him- 
self while ,n captivity followitiu- his capture by the Russians in 1914. With W 
l)Khka we made a circuit of the town. 

wilh'f h?.'' i", ''"'''"'^'' l''""^' '"^•'"'•e^'.l"''l.v at the junction of the Irkut and Kuda Rivers 
last, led the ( zech forces when they routed the Bolsheviks. We saw the prison 
. '^ ,";wn';."r' "^,'^'' '"^■^"' ^^''^-^ "•^'^'" f"-- "l'»Iitical prisoners." now occupied bv

,,. Mv , f Ti, ' '^'-V -'""' '"t; a« "n "'" ' ibenan towns, the side streets are poor, 
Han> of he houses bein- built of IoK^s. The churches, however, are remarkablv 
.ne and Irkutsk is certainly "the city of churches." There must be a score of 
arue churches of the orthodox faith. The churches are nearlv al built of whi?e 
brick or wlme ,.laster and, as they t^isten in the sunliRht, theV are most impres
